results.name: Triangle T(n,k): the number of binary sequences of n zeros and n ones in which the longest run is of length k.
link: Andrew Woods, Rows n = 1..50 of triangle, flattened
formula: Let h(n,p,k) := sum(j=0..floor((n-p)/k), (-1)^j*C(p,j)*C(n-1-j*k,p-1)) with h(n,p,0) := 0, and let g(n,k) := 2*sum(i=1..n, h(n,i,k)*(h(n,i,k)+h(n,i+1,k))). Then T(n,k) = g(n,k)-g(n,k-1).
example: The second row counts the sets {0101, 1010} and {0011, 0110, 1001, 1100}.
results.author: _Andrew Woods_, Sep 28 2013
